week3.practice2_html:
What it is

The Popeye Protocol is a simple daily focus on restoring iron from food and gentle supplements, while avoiding habits that block your body from absorbing it. Iron is the raw fuel your follicles need to stay anchored and grow sturdy strands.

Why this practice matters for you now

Mimi, youâ€™re in the stabilization phase â€” shedding is settling, but your follicles are rebuilding after long stress and thyroid shifts. Because youâ€™ve had low iron before and eat only one protein-rich meal per day, this step is your â€œbig domino.â€ Replenishing iron now helps your new baby hairs strengthen as your stress hormones steady heading into your regrowth season this spring.

  1. Add one ironâ€‘rich food daily. Rotate between lean red meat, lentils, tofu, or dark leafy greens sautÃ©ed with a bit of olive oil.
  2. Pair with vitaminâ€¯C. Add citrus, tomatoes, or bell pepper to each ironâ€‘focused meal to boost absorption naturally.
  3. Space out inhibitors. Keep coffee, tea, and calciumâ€‘rich foods at least 60â€¯minutes away from your iron meal.
  4. Include a second protein touch. A boiled egg, Greek yogurt, or small handful of pumpkin seeds between meals supplies amino acids your follicles crave.
  5. Track your energy and color. Note any rise in stamina or warmth in your cheeks â€” both signal improving iron stores.

week3.practice3_html:
